title: Alternative for Russell's definition of a description binder

blocks.name: caiota
blocks.content: Extend class notation with an alternative for Russell's definition of a description binder (inverted iota).
blocks.origin: prop class caiota(setvar s0, wff w0) { iota'(s0, w0) }

blocks.name: diff.caiota.s
diff.caiota.c
diff.caiota.w
aiotajust
blocks.content: Soundness justification theorem for ~ df-aiota . (Contributed by AV, 24-Aug-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm aiotajust(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  |- wceq(cint(cab(s0, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s0))))), cint(cab(s2, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s2))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  inteqi(cab(s0, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s0)))), cab(s2, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s2)))))
  eqtri(cab(s0, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s0)))), cab(s2, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s2)))), cab(hs0, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))))
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s0))), wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(hs0))))
  eqeq2d(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s0)), csn(cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  sneq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))
  cbvabv(hs0, s2, wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(hs0))), wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s2))))
  eqeq2d(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(hs0)), csn(cv(s2)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))
  sneq(cv(hs0), cv(s2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))
  diff.cab.s(s0, s1, w0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s0))))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(s2))))
  diff.wceq.s(s2, cab(s1, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))
  diff.cab.s(s2, s1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.csn.s(s2, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm aiotajust(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ ‚ãÇ { s0 | { s1 | w0 } = { s0 } } = ‚ãÇ { s2 | { s1 | w0 } = { s2 } }
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  inteqi({ s0 | { s1 | w0 } = { s0 } }, { s2 | { s1 | w0 } = { s2 } })
  eqtri({ s0 | { s1 | w0 } = { s0 } }, { s2 | { s1 | w0 } = { s2 } }, { hs0 | { s1 | w0 } = { hs0 } })
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, { s1 | w0 } = { s0 }, { s1 | w0 } = { hs0 })
  eqeq2d({ s1 | w0 }, { s0 }, { hs0 }, s0 = hs0)
  sneq(s0, hs0)
  cbvabv(hs0, s2, { s1 | w0 } = { hs0 }, { s1 | w0 } = { s2 })
  eqeq2d({ s1 | w0 }, { hs0 }, { s2 }, hs0 = s2)
  sneq(hs0, s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, { s1 | w0 }, { hs0 })
  diff.cab.s(s0, s1, w0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w({ s1 | w0 } = { s0 })
  diff.hs0.w({ s1 | w0 } = { s2 })
  diff.wceq.s(s2, { s1 | w0 }, { hs0 })
  diff.cab.s(s2, s1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.csn.s(s2, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
}

blocks.name: df-aiota
blocks.content: Alternate version of Russell's definition of a description binder, which can be read as "the unique ` x ` such that ` ph ` ", where ` ph ` ordinarily contains ` x ` as a free variable. Our definition is meaningful only when there is exactly one ` x ` such that ` ph ` is true (see ~ aiotaval ); otherwise, it is not a set (see ~ aiotaexb ), or even more concrete, it is the universe ` _V ` (see ~ aiotavb ). Since this is an alternative for ~ df-iota , we call this symbol ` iota' ` _alternate iota_ in the following. The advantage of this definition is the clear distinguishability of the defined and undefined cases: the alternate iota over a wff is defined iff it is a set (see ~ aiotaexb ). With the original definition, there is no corresponding theorem ` ( E! x ph <-> ( iota x ph ) =/= (/) ) ` , because ` (/) ` can be a valid unique set satisfying a wff (see, for example, ~ iota0def ). Only the right to left implication would hold, see (negated) ~ iotanul . For defined cases, however, both definitions ~ df-iota and ~ df-aiota are equivalent, see ~ reuaiotaiota . (Proposed by BJ, 13-Aug-2022.) (Contributed by AV, 24-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: dfaiota2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the alternate version of Russell's definition of a description binder. Definition 8.18 in [Quine] p. 56. (Contributed by AV, 24-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: reuabaiotaiota
blocks.content: The iota and the alternate iota over a wff ` ph ` are equal iff there is a unique satisfying value of ` { x | ph } = { y } ` . (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: reuaiotaiota
blocks.content: The iota and the alternate iota over a wff ` ph ` are equal iff there is a unique value ` x ` satisfying ` ph ` . (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: aiotaexb
blocks.content: The alternate iota over a wff ` ph ` is a set iff there is a unique value ` x ` satisfying ` ph ` . (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: aiotavb
blocks.content: The alternate iota over a wff ` ph ` is the universe iff there is no unique value ` x ` satisfying ` ph ` . (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm aiotavb(setvar s0, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wn(weu(s0, w0)), wceq(caiota(s0, w0), universe))
} = {
  xchnxbir(weu(s0, w0), wceq(caiota(s0, w0), universe), wcel(caiota(s0, w0), universe))
  3bitr4i(wn(wcel(caiota(s0, w0), universe)), wceq(caiota(s0, w0), universe), wn(wcel(cint(cab(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0))))), universe)), wceq(cint(cab(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0))))), universe))
  intnex(cab(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))))
  notbii(wcel(caiota(s0, w0), universe), wcel(cint(cab(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0))))), universe))
  eleq1i(caiota(s0, w0), universe, cint(cab(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0))))))
  eqeq1i(caiota(s0, w0), universe, cint(cab(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0))))))
  df-aiota(s0, hs0, w0)
  aiotaexb(s0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm aiotavb(setvar s0, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (¬¨ ‚àÉ!(s0, w0)‚Üî iota'(s0, w0)= ùïå)
} = {
  xchnxbir(‚àÉ!(s0, w0), iota'(s0, w0)= ùïå, iota'(s0, w0)‚àà ùïå)
  3bitr4i(¬¨ iota'(s0, w0)‚àà ùïå, iota'(s0, w0)= ùïå, ¬¨ ‚ãÇ { hs0 | { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 } } ‚àà ùïå, ‚ãÇ { hs0 | { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 } } = ùïå)
  intnex({ hs0 | { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 } })
  notbii(iota'(s0, w0)‚àà ùïå, ‚ãÇ { hs0 | { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 } } ‚àà ùïå)
  eleq1i(iota'(s0, w0), universe, ‚ãÇ { hs0 | { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 } })
  eqeq1i(iota'(s0, w0), universe, ‚ãÇ { hs0 | { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 } })
  df-aiota(s0, hs0, w0)
  aiotaexb(s0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: iotan0aiotaex
blocks.content: If the iota over a wff ` ph ` is not empty, the alternate iota over ` ph ` is a set. (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: aiotaexaiotaiota
blocks.content: The alternate iota over a wff ` ph ` is a set iff the iota and the alternate iota over ` ph ` are equal. (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: aiotaval
blocks.content: Theorem 8.19 in [Quine] p. 57. This theorem is the fundamental property of (alternate) iota. (Contributed by AV, 24-Aug-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm aiotaval(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(caiota(s0, w0), cv(s1)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  eqtrd(caiota(s0, w0), cv(s1), cio(s0, w0), wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  3imtr3i(wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(caiota(s0, w0), cio(s0, w0)), wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(s1))), weu(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))))
  mpbiri(wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(s1))), weu(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))), weu(hs0, wceq(csn(cv(s1)), csn(cv(hs0)))))
  mpbir(weu(hs0, wceq(csn(cv(s1)), csn(cv(hs0)))), weu(hs0, wceq(csn(cv(hs0)), csn(cv(s1)))))
  eusnsn(hs0, s1)
  eubii(hs0, wceq(csn(cv(s1)), csn(cv(hs0))), wceq(csn(cv(hs0)), csn(cv(s1))))
  eqcom(csn(cv(s1)), csn(cv(hs0)))
  eubidv(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(s1))), wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0))), wceq(csn(cv(s1)), csn(cv(hs0))))
  eqeq1(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(s1)), csn(cv(hs0)))
  absn(s0, cv(s1), w0)
  bitri(weu(hs0, wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(hs0)))), wceq(caiota(s0, w0), cio(s0, w0)), wceq(cio(s0, w0), caiota(s0, w0)))
  reuabaiotaiota(hs0, s0, w0)
  eqcom(cio(s0, w0), caiota(s0, w0))
  iotaval(s0, s1, w0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cab(s0, w0), csn(cv(s1))))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm aiotaval(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (‚àÄ(s0,(w0 ‚Üî s0 = s1))‚Üí iota'(s0, w0)= s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  eqtrd(iota'(s0, w0), s1, iota(s0, w0), ‚àÄ(s0,(w0 ‚Üî s0 = s1)))
  3imtr3i(‚àÄ(s0,(w0 ‚Üî s0 = s1)), iota'(s0, w0)= iota(s0, w0), { s0 | w0 } = { s1 }, ‚àÉ!(hs0, { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 }))
  mpbiri({ s0 | w0 } = { s1 }, ‚àÉ!(hs0, { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 }), ‚àÉ!(hs0, { s1 } = { hs0 }))
  mpbir(‚àÉ!(hs0, { s1 } = { hs0 }), ‚àÉ!(hs0, { hs0 } = { s1 }))
  eusnsn(hs0, s1)
  eubii(hs0, { s1 } = { hs0 }, { hs0 } = { s1 })
  eqcom({ s1 }, { hs0 })
  eubidv(hs0, { s0 | w0 } = { s1 }, { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 }, { s1 } = { hs0 })
  eqeq1({ s0 | w0 }, { s1 }, { hs0 })
  absn(s0, s1, w0)
  bitri(‚àÉ!(hs0, { s0 | w0 } = { hs0 }), iota'(s0, w0)= iota(s0, w0), iota(s0, w0)= iota'(s0, w0))
  reuabaiotaiota(hs0, s0, w0)
  eqcom(iota(s0, w0), iota'(s0, w0))
  iotaval(s0, s1, w0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w({ s0 | w0 } = { s1 })
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: aiota0def
blocks.content: Example for a defined alternate iota being the empty set, i.e., ` A. y x C_ y ` is a wff satisfied by a unique value ` x ` , namely ` x = (/) ` (the empty set is the one and only set which is a subset of every set). This corresponds to ~ iota0def . (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm aiota0def(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wceq(caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), emptycls)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mp2(wceq(caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), emptycls), wcel(emptycls, universe), wal(s0, wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))))
  0ex()
  ax-gen(s0, wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls)))
  al0ssb(s1, cv(s0))
  vtoclg(hs0, emptycls, universe, wi(wal(s0, wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))), wceq(caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), emptycls)), wi(wal(s0, wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wceq(caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), cv(hs0))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wal(s0, wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wceq(caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), cv(hs0)), wal(s0, wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))), wceq(caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), emptycls))
  albidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls)))
  bibi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  eqeq2(cv(hs0), emptycls, cv(s0))
  eqeq2(cv(hs0), emptycls, caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  aiotaval(s0, hs0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.c(emptycls)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wal(s0, wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))), wceq(caiota(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), emptycls)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), emptycls)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm aiota0def(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  ‚ä¢ iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))= ‚àÖ
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  mp2(iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))= ‚àÖ, ‚àÖ ‚àà ùïå, ‚àÄ(s0,(‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = ‚àÖ)))
  0ex()
  ax-gen(s0, (‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = ‚àÖ))
  al0ssb(s1, s0)
  vtoclg(hs0, emptycls, universe, (‚àÄ(s0,(‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = ‚àÖ))‚Üí iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))= ‚àÖ), (‚àÄ(s0,(‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = hs0))‚Üí iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))= hs0))
  imbi12d(hs0 = ‚àÖ, ‚àÄ(s0,(‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = hs0)), iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))= hs0, ‚àÄ(s0,(‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = ‚àÖ)), iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))= ‚àÖ)
  albidv(s0, hs0 = ‚àÖ, (‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = hs0), (‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = ‚àÖ))
  bibi2d(hs0 = ‚àÖ, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1), s0 = hs0, s0 = ‚àÖ)
  eqeq2(hs0, emptycls, s0)
  eqeq2(hs0, emptycls, iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)))
  aiotaval(s0, hs0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.c(emptycls)
  diff.hs0.w((‚àÄ(s0,(‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1)‚Üî s0 = ‚àÖ))‚Üí iota'(s0, ‚àÄ(s1, s0 ‚äÜ s1))= ‚àÖ))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, emptycls)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: aiota0ndef
blocks.content: Example for an undefined alternate iota being no set, i.e., ` A. y y e. x ` is a wff not satisfied by a (unique) value ` x ` (there is no set, and therefore certainly no unique set, which contains every set). This is different from ~ iota0ndef , where the iota still is a set (the empty set). (Contributed by AV, 25-Aug-2022.)
